title: Error & Exception Handling
overview: Learn how to handle errors and exceptions in Python using try, except, finally, and custom exceptions. Proper error handling makes your programs more robust and prevents crashes.
practice: Write a program that handles ZeroDivisionError.
Use try-except-finally to open and close a file safely.
summary: Exception handling in Python allows you to gracefully manage errors and ensure your program runs reliably. Using try, except, and finally blocks, along with custom exceptions, helps prevent crashes and handle edge cases effectively.
